instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR: What is PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR? PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR is PPBUS_G3H after it has passed through a backlight fuse and a transistor that allows power through when BKLT_PLT_RST_L and LCD_BKLT_EN are present. .
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage all around lcd connector and other side of the board. Replaced everything. Powers on, chimes but no backlight.

J9000 pins 2 and 3 are 3.4v pin 4 3.4V

<CHIP>U9701</CHIP> replaced but feedback TP was burned. Ran jumper to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR</SIGNAL> but still no backlight and diode mode is .408

What to check next? Using a known good screen

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
I like to believe you already checked F9700.

Do you have FOR SURE good contact between A5/<CHIP>U9701</CHIP> and K/<DIODE>D9701</DIODE>?
<RESISTOR>R0910</RESISTOR> is OK?
Tried few PRAM resets?

Post <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM levels.
